io.github.tomaso2468.rpgonline

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.tomaso2468.rpgonline.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a game.
    Author:
    Tomaso2468
    See Also:
    RPGConfig

      • start

           throws RenderException
        Starts the game.

        RenderException - If an error occurs in the renderer.

                           throws RenderException

        Parameters:

        RenderException

      • loop

        protected void loop()
             throws RenderException
        Runs a single game loop. This method includes the code for waiting for the next update and frame.
        Throws:
        RenderException - If an error occurs in the renderer.

      • init

        protected void init()
             throws RenderException
        Initialises the game.
        Throws:
        RenderException - If an error occurs in the renderer.

      • update

        public final void update(Game game,
                         float delta)
                  throws RenderException
        Updates the game.

        preUpdate and postUpdate should be overridden instead of this method. Rendering should not be done in this method but it will still work.

        Parameters:
        game - The game to update.
        delta - The delta value in seconds.
        Throws:
        RenderException - If an error occurs using the renderer.
        See Also:
        preUpdate(Game, float), postUpdate(Game, float)

      • preUpdate

        public void preUpdate(Game game,
                      float delta)
               throws RenderException
        Called before a game update.
        Parameters:
        game - The game to update.
        delta - The delta value in seconds.
        Throws:
        RenderException - If an error occurs using the renderer.

                       float delta)

        delta - The delta value in seconds.
        Throws:

                         Renderer renderer)
                  throws RenderException
        Renders the game.
        Parameters:

        renderer - The renderer to use.
        Throws:

      • preRender

        public void preRender(Game game,
                      Renderer renderer)
               throws RenderException
        Called before a render. This method also starts the debug information for this frame. When overriding this method the superclass version should be called first before doing anything else.
        Parameters:
        game - The game to render.
        renderer - The renderer.
        Throws:
        RenderException - If an error occurs using the renderer.

      • round1DP

        private double round1DP(double value)
        Rounds the value to 1 decimal place.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to round.
        Returns:
        A rounded value.

      • postRender

        public void postRender(Game game,
                       Renderer renderer)
                throws RenderException
        Called after a render. This method also end and renders the debug information for this frame. When overriding this method the superclass version should be called last after any other code has been inserted. If you want to add additional information override drawDebugLeft and drawDebugRight.
        Parameters:
        game - The game to render.
        renderer - The renderer.
        Throws:
        RenderException - If an error occurs using the renderer.
        See Also:
        drawDebugLeft(Graphics, float), drawDebugRight(Graphics, float)

      • drawDebugLeft

                              float y)
        Draws additional information of the left side of the debug screen.
        Parameters:
        g - The current graphics context.
        y - The Y position of text.
        Returns:
        The new Y position of text.

                               float y)

        The new Y position of text.

                               java.lang.String s,

                               boolean side)

        Parameters:

        s - The string to draw.
        y - The Y position of text.
        side - true if the text should be rendered on the right of the screen false otherwise.

        The new Y position of text.

      • drawDebugLineLabel

        protected float drawDebugLineLabel(Graphics g,
                                   java.lang.String label,
                                   java.lang.String data,
                                   float y,
                                   boolean side)
        Draws debug information as a labelled value.
        Parameters:
        g - The current graphics context.
        label - The label of the data.
        data - The data to draw.
        y - The Y position of text.
        side - true if the text should be rendered on the right of the screen false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The new Y position of text.

      • drawDebugLineRYWHigh

        protected float drawDebugLineRYWHigh(Graphics g,
                                     java.lang.String label,
                                     long data,
                                     long yellow,
                                     long red,
                                     float y,
                                     boolean side)
        Draws debug information as a labelled value in a different color depending on the value of the data. This method treats higher values as better so if the value is below red the text is a pale red, if the value is below yellow the text is a pale yellow and if the value is below both the text is a pale red.
        Parameters:
        g - The current graphics context.
        label - The label of the data.
        data - The data to draw.
        yellow - The point where the text turns yellow.
        red - The point where the text turns red.
        y - The Y position of text.
        side - true if the text should be rendered on the right of the screen false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The new Y position of text.

      • drawDebugLineRYWLow

        protected float drawDebugLineRYWLow(Graphics g,
                                    java.lang.String label,
                                    long data,
                                    long yellow,
                                    long red,
                                    float y,
                                    boolean side)
        Draws debug information as a labelled value in a different color depending on the value of the data. This method treats lower values as better so if the value is above red the text is a pale red, if the value is above yellow the text is a pale yellow and if the value is above both the text is a pale red.
        Parameters:
        g - The current graphics context.
        label - The label of the data.
        data - The data to draw.
        yellow - The point where the text turns yellow.
        red - The point where the text turns red.
        y - The Y position of text.
        side - true if the text should be rendered on the right of the screen false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The new Y position of text.

      • drawDebugLineRYWHigh

        protected float drawDebugLineRYWHigh(Graphics g,
                                     java.lang.String label,
                                     double data,
                                     double yellow,
                                     double red,
                                     float y,
                                     boolean side)
        Draws debug information as a labelled value in a different color depending on the value of the data. This method treats higher values as better so if the value is below red the text is a pale red, if the value is below yellow the text is a pale yellow and if the value is below both the text is a pale red.
        Parameters:
        g - The current graphics context.
        label - The label of the data.
        data - The data to draw.
        yellow - The point where the text turns yellow.
        red - The point where the text turns red.
        y - The Y position of text.
        side - true if the text should be rendered on the right of the screen false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The new Y position of text.

      • drawDebugLineRYWLow

        protected float drawDebugLineRYWLow(Graphics g,
                                    java.lang.String label,
                                    double data,
                                    double yellow,
                                    double red,
                                    float y,
                                    boolean side)
        Draws debug information as a labelled value in a different color depending on the value of the data. This method treats lower values as better so if the value is above red the text is a pale red, if the value is above yellow the text is a pale yellow and if the value is above both the text is a pale red.
        Parameters:
        g - The current graphics context.
        label - The label of the data.
        data - The data to draw.
        yellow - The point where the text turns yellow.
        red - The point where the text turns red.
        y - The Y position of text.
        side - true if the text should be rendered on the right of the screen false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The new Y position of text.

      • drawDebugLineRAM

        protected float drawDebugLineRAM(Graphics g,
                                 java.lang.String label,
                                 double data,
                                 double max,
                                 double yellow,
                                 double red,
                                 float y,
                                 boolean side)
        Draws debug information as a labelled value in a different color depending on the value of the data. This method treats higher values as better so if the value is below red the text is a pale red, if the value is below yellow the text is a pale yellow and if the value is below both the text is a pale red. This method treats the inputs as ram information in mebibytes (MiB).
        Parameters:
        g - The current graphics context.
        label - The label of the data.
        data - The data to draw.
        yellow - The point where the text turns yellow.
        red - The point where the text turns red.
        y - The Y position of text.
        side - true if the text should be rendered on the right of the screen false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The new Y position of text.

      • changeState

                        Transition enter,
                        Transition leave)
        Changes the game state to the one specified.
        Parameters:

        enter - The transition used when entering the new state.
        leave - The transition used when leaving the old state.

      • getFPSCap

        public float getFPSCap()
        Gets the maximum FPS value allowed. This is not used if Vsync is on.
        Returns:
        A positive float value or 0 to disable the FPS cap.
        See Also:
        setFPSCap(float), setVsync(boolean), isVsync(), getFPS()

      • setFPSCap

        public void setFPSCap(float fpsCap)
        Sets the maximum FPS value allowed.
        Parameters:
        fpsCap - A positive float value or 0 to disable the FPS cap.
        See Also:
        getFPSCap(), setVsync(boolean), isVsync(), getFPS()

      • getFPS

        public float getFPS()
        Gets the current FPS of the game.
        Returns:
        A float value.
        See Also:
        getFPSCap(), setFPSCap(float), setVsync(boolean), isVsync()

      • setFullscreen

        public void setFullscreen(boolean fullscreen)
                   throws RenderException
        Changes the games fullscreen status. When the game is not in fullscreen mode it will take up half of the screen on each axis. This method does nothing if the game is already in the requested mode.
        Parameters:
        fullscreen - true if the game should be in fullscreen, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        RenderException - If an error occurs changing between display modes.
        See Also:
        isFullscreen()

      • isFullscreen

        public boolean isFullscreen()
        Gets the fullscreen status of the game.
        Returns:
        true if the game is in fullscreen, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setFullscreen(boolean)

      • isAntialias

        public boolean isAntialias()
        Gets if the game is using antialiasing. This does not apply to post processing antialiasing used by PostProcessing.
        Returns:
        true if antialiasing is enabled, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        PostProcessing, setAntialias(boolean)

      • setAntialias

        public void setAntialias(boolean antialias)
        Sets if antialiasing is enabled. This does not apply to post processing antialiasing used by PostProcessing.
        Parameters:
        antialias - true if antialiasing should be enabled, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        PostProcessing, #getAntialias()

      • isClearEveryFrame

        public boolean isClearEveryFrame()
        Gets if the game should clear the screen before rendering a frame.
        Returns:
        true if clearing is enabled, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setClearEveryFrame(boolean)

      • setClearEveryFrame

        Parameters:

        See Also:
        isClearEveryFrame()

      • getIcon

        public java.net.URL getIcon()
        Gets the URL of the icon for this game.
        Returns:
        A URL object or null if no icon is set.
        See Also:
        setIcon(URL)

      • setIcon

        public void setIcon(java.net.URL icon)
        Sets the icon for this game.
        Parameters:
        icon - A URL object or null to set no icon (default).
        See Also:
        getIcon()

      • isMouseGrabbed

        public boolean isMouseGrabbed()
        Determines if the mouse is grabbed by the window.
        Returns:
        true if the mouse is grabbed, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setMouseGrabbed(boolean)

      • setMouseGrabbed

        public void setMouseGrabbed(boolean mouseGrabbed)
        Sets if the mouse is grabbed by the window.
        Parameters:
        mouseGrabbed - true if the mouse is grabbed, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isMouseGrabbed()

      • getMinDelta

        public float getMinDelta()
        Gets the minimum delta value for this game.
        Returns:
        A value in seconds.
        See Also:
        setMinDelta(float)

      • setMinDelta

        public void setMinDelta(float minDelta)
        Sets the minimum delta value for this game.
        Parameters:
        minDelta - A value in seconds.
        See Also:
        getMinDelta()

      • getMaxDelta

        public float getMaxDelta()
        Gets the maximum delta value for this game.
        Returns:
        A value in seconds.
        See Also:
        setMaxDelta(float)

      • setMaxDelta

        public void setMaxDelta(float maxDelta)
        Sets the maximum delta value for this game.
        Parameters:
        maxDelta - A value in seconds.
        See Also:
        getMaxDelta()

      • exit

        public void exit(int code)
        Exits the game. This method disposes of the renderer, audio system an then the application.
        Parameters:
        code - The system exit code.

      • getInput

        public Input getInput()
        Gets the games input. A new instance is not created for each frame.
        Returns:
        An input instance.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Gets the height of the game window.
        Returns:
        A positive integer.
        See Also:
        getWidth()

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Gets the width of the game window.
        Returns:
        A positive integer.
        See Also:
        getHeight()
